website_summaries.verdict: Though it won't work for all book collections, the design of this bookend and book holder combo unit is worth considering for a stack of paperbacks or small, fairly lightweight books.
pros: Sports a unique design that connects the two ends with an adjustable metal back piece that helps hold books in place
Comes with a 90-day money back guarantee
cons: Has better structure when the unit is full

customer_reviews.title: Almost really cool
customer_reviews.text: I almost really love this. It seems really cool online. And it's cool in person, but not as much as I thought it would be. It's cute and holds the books pretty well. But really, it only really works if it's extended the whole say out. It doesn't stay closed in if the books push on the sides.
customer_reviews.author: Bethany Blaine

customer_reviews.title: Only for light-weight books
customer_reviews.text: It is a cute bookend, but the adjustable arm on the back wasn't very tight so my small but heavier books would push it open allowing the books to fall. Update. Seller suggested I may have gotten a defective bookend and offered to refund or replace the merchandise. I refused because it is really cute, and even if it is defective, it works fine for my smaller, paperback books. KnowingI may have gotten a defective one, and the seller willing correct the issue has made me upgrade my review. If I were to purchase more bookends, I would not hesitate to purchase this item again. Thank you LvDD.
customer_reviews.author: Ps118

customer_reviews.title: Shelf organizer
customer_reviews.text: Received as expected. I ordered the larger one and it works well for me. I wouldn't recommend this for hard cover or heavier books though. It's pretty light weighted and it's a bit on the flimsy side. I wouldn't have described this as metal iron though, more like tin. The only reason I mention that is because I wouldn't expect it to support anything for heavy leaning. I ordered in black. It looks real nice on the shelf and holds assorted papers and small books neatly. It fully serves my purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Japers

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, just what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my son's dresser. Holds his favorite books with some room to grow. A lighter red but still looks good with the other red decorations in his room.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend for Vinyl Records!
customer_reviews.text: I was in need of a way to hold my records. Not wanting to buy an actual record player stand (they're quite pricey for a nice new one!) unless I could find an actual vintage one to re-paint, I decided to look at bookends and bookshelves. The large version of this book holder PERFECTLY holds LPs. I have about 75 currently and it only fills up about 2/3rds of the shelf. When I fill out this one, I am certainly going to buy another. Quality is great, color is cute, it's great!
customer_reviews.author: LizTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Very Creative
customer_reviews.text: Very creative metal book stand. Great book stand for affordable price.. The adjustable feature is very innovative. Keeps the books well organized, looks clean and neat. Meets the expectation.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just Okay
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased these bookends and was somewhat disappointed in the quality. The bookends is somewhat flimsy and come in mass produced Asian packaging that look like something you might pick up in a Dollar General. I would have less criticism if they were priced around $5 but at $13 I felt they were only “okay”. It appears multiple sellers (in separate listings) offer the same bookends on Amazon at a similar price, I would go with whomever is cheapest it appears the quality will be the same.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Fun and functional decoration
customer_reviews.text: Very nice product. Despite being adjustable, it only adjusts when you want it to. I was worried that the weight of the books would too much for it, causing the product to slide open over time. That's not the case. I have it on a bookshelf holding about 15 lbs of books and they're all upright and staying put I like the look of this and the fact that I can adjust it to accommodate a large number of books. All in all, it does what you want it to and looks good while doing it.
customer_reviews.author: tswa81

customer_reviews.title: This is a great book end
customer_reviews.text: This is a great book end . I have about 40lbs worth of 12x12 scrapbooks all lined up and once I got them all in the products didn't flinch . It seems small but it does the job . This could easily hold up textbooks or any regular reading books .
customer_reviews.author: emillie

customer_reviews.title: CRAP
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 8 yr old daughter so she could keep her small paperback chapter books in it- all 5 or 6 of them and this product is CRAP! It’s lightweight, thin, and flimsy! If you take one book out and ones next to it lean (because of the gap) the bookends open up and all the books fall out. I guess it’s fine if you never plan on using the books.
customer_reviews.author: sherry Wright

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended, well made and heavy duty!
customer_reviews.text: I love my books and will not accept cheap book holders. This fit the bill perfectly - so excited, I purchased two! Well made with inserts spaced inside so your books are not smashed together. The holder expands easily and really holds a lot of weight. I used this in my kitchen on floating wall shelves to hold my many, heavy cookbooks. It works great.
customer_reviews.author: New Jersey Mama

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I needed bookends for my desktop that sits in front of a window. I love that this one has a back which helps keep my book from falling onto the window ledge. It's really cute too!
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Works amazing for on top of our dresser to contain "bedtime" ...
customer_reviews.text: Works amazing for on top of our dresser to contain "bedtime" books for our toddler. She can pull them out easily, but we can keep them organized and up out of reach when she doesn't need to be playing with them.
customer_reviews.author: ThirtysomethingIVFMom

customer_reviews.title: The MOST useful thing for desks!
customer_reviews.text: I have a significant number of large binders on top of my desk and I usually let them stand on their own. Textbooks and binders are usually able to do this - but when one was leaning, they all fell. I ordered this (reluctantly) because there's really nothing else like it. The $20 or so was ABSOLUTELY worth it - right now it's holding 3x three-inch binders and two textbooks.
customer_reviews.author: Ronnie Januszki

customer_reviews.title: Worth it! Works like it should and plan on buying another soon.
customer_reviews.text: I rarely write reviews for anything, but I was beyond excited to try this bookend. I had some doubts because I have large items I wanted to stand up, but it’s holding up great and I love it!!!! I do wish it retracted by itself whenever a book was taken out but for now I love it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I have looked a long time for the perfect bookends. My search is over. These bookends are extremely well made, sturdy and very functional...even with just a few books. Plus, they look good. Everything you could want...especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: kanterTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: durable

customer_reviews.title: Great to be adjustable and the Large is what I ...
customer_reviews.text: A bit shorter than I had thought it would be, but it works perfectly. Great to be adjustable and the Large is what I would call an average size. Ideal for a flat shelf without ends.

customer_reviews.title: good seller/ product not super strong
